text:
Oh I see.. thank you very much for clarifying! I just thought Digital Effects was 100% artsy and I wanted to go more to the Technical side, so that’s why I was mainly considering MSC.
I definitely want to start learning Python; I am now working in a software company so I asked one of my coworkers who is a developer if he could teach me the basics and then I would practice on my own
I learned last year at the course Maya, Zbrush, 3d equalizer, Mari, substance. But mostly Maya

It gets a bit busy working during the day.. specially with the course. But it’s completely fine because it is my greatest passion and I want to get into VFX, there’s no other way than pushing further :D

I would say my dream is to work in Effects in movies or tv.. But at the same time now that I’m learning to build assets and do procedural art I really really enjoy it. So I would say a mix of that, if that’s posible! But it’s definitely that way. And I also see myself working in a team where each person has a different task but we all collaborate on one great result
But what I most enjoy is doing simulations. I find them so fascinating!
